thread.title: Marlins’ Ichiro pitches inning in relief
thread.title_full: Marlins’ Ichiro pitches inning in relief

author: The Associated Press
title: Marlins’ Ichiro pitches inning in relief
text:
Share 
PHILADELPHIA — Ichiro Suzuki hit 88 mph and induced a swing and miss with a breaking pitch during a one-inning relief appearance for the Miami Marlins on Sunday in their regular-season finale against the Philadelphia Phillies. 
The 10-time outfield Gold Glove Award winner had never pitched in a major-league game before entering in the bottom of the eighth inning. 
He allowed a leadoff double to Odubel Herrera, who later scored on a double to deep right by Darnell Sweeney. After throwing mostly fastballs to the first few hitters, Ichiro mixed in an upper-70s breaking pitch to Freddy Galvis, inducing an awkward whiff with his first one. 
Suzuki allowed one run on two hits with a ground out and two fly outs. 
Suzuki, a 15-year big league veteran, finished this season with 2,935 major-league hits and another 1,278 hits in nine professional seasons with the Orix Blue Wave in Japan. 
The Marlins lost 7-2.
